title: About
text:
Hi, my name is Luke Li and I am a rising senior at Lexington High School (Year of Graduation 2026).
Github: https://github.com/lukearoni
Email: lukelex2008@gmail.com
This project analyzes and models the impact of financial literacy upon personal financial decisions. Here is the link to the github repository: https://github.com/lukearoni/financial-literacy
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp.

title: Mathematical Model
text:
Model
\[
\log\left(\frac{\Pr(\text{Pays Credit Card in Full})}{1 - \Pr(\text{Pays Credit Card in Full})}\right)
= 0.677 + 0.047 \times \text{Financial Literacy Score}
\]

title: Mathematical Model
text:
Parameters
Financial literacy score is the main parameter in the model. It is a composite of scores from 5 questions meant to gauge the financial literacy level of each survey respondent. It ranges from 0 to 5, one point per correct question.

title: Credit Cards and Financial Literacy
text: Knowledge regarding personal finance has a large impact on financial decisions that every person makes. Using data from the 2021 NFCS survey, we seek to understand the relationship between paying off a credit card bill and financial literacy in people across the United States. We modeled credit card behavior, a binary TRUE/FALSE variable (true meaning always pays card in full, false meaning not always paid), as a logistic function of financial literacy. Individuals with a higher financial literacy score were more likely to pay off their credit card consistently. Therefore, a person who has more financial knowledge will make more sound financial decisions, such as paying off their credit card.
